text:
according to MS Excel online doc., dot or period is a valid character for range name.  However, XSFName.validate() does not permit dot - such as "my.range" - as a cell range name.  Please kindly fix it.

Thank you.
creator: mikeliucc@gmail.com

text:
You are correct. Per the Excel Named Range docs [1]:

> Spaces are not allowed as part of a name. Use the underscore character (_) and period (.) as word separators, such as, Sales_Tax or First.Quarter.

I broke this in r1749305 when trying to restrict named ranges in bug 56781

[1] https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Define-and-use-names-in-formulas-4D0F13AC-53B7-422E-AFD2-ABD7FF379C64#bmsyntax_rules_for_names
creator: onealj@apache.org
